info.title: Query REST API Documentation and Client
info.description: This is the REST API documentation for the Voyent Query Service.  It's also a dynamic client that you can use to exercise the API and try it out.

tags.name: Find
tags.description: Queries that use the find() API.

tags.name: Aggregate
tags.description: Queries that use the aggregate() API.

tags.name: Chain
tags.description: Queries based on a series of Queries and Transformations.

get.description: Execute any kind of Query - Find, Aggregate, or Chain, using the provided id as the key.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Runs the Query in debug mode which returns additional information along with the results.

200.description: Returns the results from the executed query.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account under which one or more realms are managed.

parameters.name: realmId
parameters.description: The realm under which this resource is managed.

get.description: Retrieve one or more Queries.  Instead of specifying a specific id, the results are determined by optionally setting database query options.

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: A flag indicating if you want "all" records (default) for this query or just "one". (all|one)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A valid search query.  If omitted, the default query is used.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specify which fields to include/exclude in the response.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Other options for the query (e.g. paging and sorting).

200.description: All resources that match the search pattern.

delete.description: Deletes one or more Queries.  Instead of specifying a specific queryFindId, the results are determined by optionally setting database query options.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A valid search query.  If omitted, the default query is used.

204.description: Indicates that the resource was successfully deleted.
